doc.field: Record Group II, Series D includes legal, personal, and professional correspondence in past possession of Sylvester Dering, but pertaining to the manangement of Ezra L'Hommedieu's estate.

Sylvester Dering was born in 1758 to Boston politician Thomas Dering (circa 1716 - 1785) and daughter of Brinley Sylvester, Mary Sylvester. During his lifetime, Sylvester Dering owned and managed Sylvester Manor, in addition to earning the rank of General during the American Revolutionary War. Dering was a brigadier in the Rhode Island state militia and saw action at the Battle of Oriskany in central NY. Sylvester Dering was also a member of the State Assembly for Suffolk County from 1803 - 1804, and became the first vice-president of the Suffolk County Agricultural Society in 1818. Sylvester Dering married Esther Sarah Havens, sister to Mary Catherine Havens L'Hommedieu, wife of Ezra L'Hommedieu; he was appointed as one of the executors of Ezra L'Hommedieu's estate and passed away in 1820. The Dering Family Papers (1755 - 1896) are housed at the William L. Clements Library of the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor, MI.
